definition: ε, ἒ ψιλόν, fifth letter of the Gr. alphabet: as numeral εʹ

children.definition: πέμπτος, but ͵ε = 5,000:—its name was εἶ, q.v., later ἒ ψιλόν; cf. ψιλός.

definition: ἐέ, or repeated ἒ ἒ ἒ ἔ, an exclamation of pain or grief;

children.definition: woe! woe! A. Ag. 1114, etc.; always doubled either once or twice and better written ἐέ (as in cod. Med. of A. and S.), or (where the metre requires an iambus) ἐή S. OC 149; but ἠέ cod. Med. in A. Th. 966.

definition: ἔα, exclam. of surprise or displeasure,

children.definition: ha! oho! esp. before a question, ἔα, τί χρῆμα; A. Pr. 300, E. Or. 1573; ἔα, τίς οὗτος . . ; Id. Hec. 501, cf. 733, al.; ἔα, τίς ἔσθʼ; Ar. Pl. 824; sts. extra versum, E. Hec. 1116, Med. 1005, al.; sts. doubled, ἔ. ἔα, ἄπεχε A. Pr. 688 (lyr.); ἔα [ἔα], ἰδού S. OC 1477 (lyr.).—Rare in Prose, ἔα, ἔφη, σοφισταί τινες Pl. Prt. 314d; ἔα, τί ἡμῖν καὶ σοί; Ev.Luc. 4.34.

definition: ἔα, Ep. and Ion. for ἦν, impf. of εἰμί. ἔᾱγα, ἐάγην [ᾰ], v. ἄγνυμι. ἔακεν· ἀλγεῖ, Hsch. ἕᾱδα, part. ἑᾱδώς, v. ἁνδάνω. ἐάλη, v. εἴλω. ἐαλόν· λυπηρόν, λυτήριον, Hsch. ἑάλωκα, ἑαλώκειν, v. ἁλίσκομαι.
ἐάν (so early Attic Inscrr., as IG 1(2).3.20, εἰάν sts. after B.C. 400, ib. 2(2).28.17, cf. PEleph. 1.8, 10 (iv B.C.)), also contr. ἤν and ἄν, v. ἤν, ἄν (B) [ᾱ], which by crasis with καί become κἄν:—

children.definition: if haply, if, regularly folld. by subj.: for its use and for examples, v. εἰ B. ΙΙ, and ἄν (A) B.Ι.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: ὃς ἐάν who soever, LXX Ge. 15.14, PTeb. 107.8 (ii B. C.), Ev.Matt. 5.19, al.; ὅσος ἐάν PPetr. 3p.120 (iii B.C.), Ev.Matt. 18.18; ὅστις ἐάν Ph. 1.220, M.Ant. 9.23; ὅπου ἐάν Ev.Matt. 8.19, etc.; ὅθεν ἐάν Gp. 1.3.3: folld. by ind., LXX 1 Ki. 2.14. [The second syll. of ἐάν is long, S. OC 1407, Ar. V. 228, Sopat. 6.9.]
wearing a thin robe, Ἠώς Antim. 84.

definition: ἑανός, ή, όν, Ep. Adj. (never in Od.):—

children.definition: fine, of fabrics and materials for wearing, ἑᾱνῷ λιτί with fine linen, Il. 18.352, 23.254; πέπλος ἑᾱνός 5.734, 8.385; ἑᾱνοῦ κασσιτέροιο tin beaten out fine, 18.613; ἱμάτιον Sapph. (?)122.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., ἑᾰνός, ὁ, fine robe, once in nom., ἀμφὶ δʼ ἄρʼ ἀμβρόσιος ἑᾰνὸς τρέμε Il. 21.507; νεκταρέου ἑᾰνοῦ 3.385; ἑᾰνῷ ἀργῆτι φαεινῷ ib. 419; ἀμβρόσιον ἑᾰνόν (acc.) 14.178; ἑᾰνῶν πτύχας ἱμεροέντων h.Cer. 176; λεπταλέῳ ἑᾰνῷ A.R. 4.169; ἑανοῖς χρυσειδέσι Hymn.Is. 109; also with the first syll. long, εἱᾰνοῦ ἁπτομένη Il. 16.9; cf. ἴανον.

data.quote: ἀμφὶ δʼ ἄρʼ ἀμβρόσιος ἑᾰνὸς τρέμε

children.definition: sail, λῦε ἑᾰνοῦ πτέρυγας Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 20.9. [ Hom. always makes ᾱ in the Adj., ᾰ in the Subst.; but later poets use ᾱ or ᾰ, as suits the metre, as Orph. A. 877, 1223.] (Cf. ἕννυμι (q.v.); the Subst. has the digamma, Il. 14.178, 21.507, whereas the Adj. has not, 18.352, 613, 23.254.)
ἔαντο· ἦσαν, Hsch.

definition: ἔαρ (A), τό, Hom. (only gen. ἔαρος), etc.; contr. ἦρ Alcm. 76: gen., dat., ἦρος, ἦρι, Lyr. ( Alc. 45), Att., and prob. Ion., cf. Hdt. 1.77, Hp. Epid. 1.1 (but ἔαρος is found in codd. of Hdt. 5.31, 7.162, al., Hp. l.c.): poet. gen., dat., εἴαρος, εἴαρι (metri gr.), Alcm. 26, h.Cer. 174 (nisi leg. ἤαρος), and later Poets (whence was formed late nom. εἶαρ Numen. ap. Ath. 9.371e, Ter.Maur. 653); cf. Hdn.Gr. 1.408 ( Hes. used ἔαρ as a monos., and ἔαρι as a trochee, Op. 492, 462):—

children.label: Α
children.definition: spring, ἔαρος δʼ ἐπιγίγνεται ὥρῃ Il. 6.148; ἔαρος νέον ἱσταμένοιο early spring, Od. 19.519; ἔαρι πολεῖν Hes. Op. 462; ἅμα τῷ ἔαρι at the beginning of spring, Hdt. 5.31, cf. Th. 4.117, 6.8; πρὸς ἔαρ Id. 5.56, etc.; πρὸς τὸ ἔ. ib. 17; περὶ τὸ ἔ. Id. 3.116; ἐξ ἦρος εἰς Ἀρκτοῦρον S. OT 1137: prov., μία χελιδὼν ἔαρ οὐ ποιεῖ Cratin. 33; also of the prime, flower of anything, ἔφηβοι . . ἔ. τοῦ δήμου Demad. Fr. 4S., cf. Hdt. 7.162, Arist. Rh. 1411a3; ἔ. ὁρόωσα looking fresh and bright, Theoc. 13.45; γενύων ἔ. the first down on a youthʼs face, AP 6.242 ( Crin.); ὕμνων ἔ. the freshest, brightest of their kind, ib. 7.12; τὸ ἔ. τῶν πτερῶν, of a peacock, Luc. Dom. 11. ( ϝεςṛ-, cf. γέαρ, γίαρ[ες], Lat. vēr, Skt. vasantas, Lith. vasara ‘summer’.)

definition: ἔαρ (B) or εἶᾰρ ( Hsch. ἦαρ, ἴαρα), τό, in Alex. Poets,

children.definition: blood, λύθρῳ τε καὶ εἴαρι πεπλήθασι Call. Hec. Fr. 328 Pf. [updated ref.]; Αἰακίδαο εἴαρος Euph. 39.3; τὸ δʼ ἐκ μέλαν εἶαρ ἔλαπτεν Call. Fr. 247 [Fr. 523 Pf.], cf. Nic. Al. 314, Opp. H. 2.618; cf. εἰαροπότης, εἰαροπῶτις.

data.quote: τὸ δʼ ἐκ μέλαν εἶαρ ἔλαπτεν

children.definition: juice, εἶαρ ἐλαίης Nic. Al. 87; ἐκ λύχνου πῖον ἔλειξαν ἔαρ Call. Aet. Fr. 177.22 Pf. [updated ref.]. (Cypr. acc. to Hsch.; identified with ἔαρ spring, by EM 307.44, Suid.; cf. Skt. ásṛk, gen. asnás, Lett. asinis ‘blood’.)

definition: ἐαρδάλη ἐπλησίασεν, Hsch. ἐαρίδας· τὰς κανθαρίδας, Id.

children.definition: plucked in spring, Pi. Fr. 75.6.
pass the spring, X. An. 3.5.15.

children.label: II
children.definition: bloom as in spring, Ph. 2.99:— Med., λειμῶνες ἄνθεσιν ἐαριζόμενοι Pl. Ax. 371c.

children.label: III
children.definition: to be like spring, μετοπώρου ἐαρίζοντος Ph. 1.13, cf. 2.643.

definition: ἐαρινός, ή, όν, Ep. εἰαρινός (also ἠαρινός h.Cer. 401, PPetr. 3p.152 (iii B. C.)); in other Poets, ἠρινός:—

children.definition: of spring, εἰαρινὴ ὥρη springtime, Il. 16.643, cf. Plb. 3.34.6; εἰαρινὰ ἄνθεα Il. 2.89; πλόος εἰαρινός Hes. Op. 678; θάλπος ἐαρινόν the heat of spring, X. Cyr. 8.6.22; ἄνεμος ἠρινός Sol. 13.19; ἠρινὰ φύλλα Pi. P. 9.46; λειμῶνος ἠρινοῦ στάχυν E. Supp. 448; ἐ. πυλαία IG 9(1).111 ( Elatea); τροπαί Ph. 2.163; μῆλα ἐ. apricots, PCair.Zen. 33.13 (iii B.C.):—neut. as Adv., in spring-time, μέλισσα λειμῶνʼ ἠρινὸν διέρχεται E. Hipp. 77 (s.v.l., ἐαρινή Sch.); γῆ ἠρινὸν θάλλουσα Id. Fr. 316.3: ἠρινὰ κελαδεῖν, of the swallow, Ar. Pax 800 (lyr.). Adv. ἐαρινῶς Hsch. s.v. ἦρις ὡς.
ewer, IG 12(3).450a1 (Thera, pl.); ἐαρόν, Hsch.
flourishing in spring, λειμῶνες Mosch. 2.67.
spring-coloured, fresh green, ἴασπις Orph. L. 267.

definition: ἐάρτερος, α, ον, poet. for ἐαρινός, Nic. Th. 380.
ἔασι, Ep. 3 pl. of εἰμί. ἔασκον, Ion. and Ep. impf. of ἐάω. ἔασσα, Dor. part. fem. of εἰμί.
ἐασφόρος ἑωσφόρος, Hsch. ἕᾰται, ἕατο, Ion. 3 pl. pres. and impf. of ἧμαι.

children.definition: to be suffered, E. Ph. 1210: c. inf., ἐατέος ἐστὶ φεύγειν Hdt. 8.108, cf. Pl. R. 401b.
ἐατέον one must suffer, E. HF 173, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be let alone or given up, ἐ. ὁ πλοῦτος Id. Hel. 905, cf. Ph. 1.564.
τὴν πόλιν ἐατέον τῆς κατοικίσεως we must let it alone as to foundation, Pl. Lg. 969c; one must dismiss from oneʼs mind, Id. Grg. 512e; one must omit, Str. 2.5.18.

definition: ἑαυτάδελφος [ ᾰ], ὁ, incorrect form for αὐτ-, CPR 1.155.

children.definition: self-hood, Procl. Theol.Plat. 5.37.

definition: ἑαυτοῦ, ῆς, οῦ, ἑαυτῷ, ῇ, ῷ, ἑαυτόν, ήν, ό, pl. ἑαυτῶν, ἑαυτοῖς, ἑαυτούς άς, ά: Ion. ἑωυτοῦ SIG 57.44 ( Milet., v B. C.), etc.; also ωὑτῆς Herod. 6.84, ωὑτέου Aret. SA 1.7 ( Ion. ἑωυ- by contraction of ἕο αὐ-, from which also Att. ἑᾱυ-, freq. written ἑατοῦ in Pap. and Inscrr., as SIG 774.2 ( Delph., i B.C.): Att. contr. αὑτοῦ, etc., which is the usual form in Trag., though ἑαυτοῦ, etc., are used (though rarely) when the metre requires, A. Pr. 188 (anap.), al.; in Att. Inscrr. αὑτοῦ prevails after B.C. 300; Cret. ϝιαυτοῦ Kohler-Ziebarth Stadtrecht von Gortyn p.34; Dor. αὐταυτοῦ, αὐσαυτοῦ (q. v.); Thess. εὑτοῦ (dat.), IG 9(2).517.16: gen.pl. ηὑτῶν Schwyzer 251 A 44 ( Cos):—

children.label: Α
children.definition: 3rd pers., of himself, herself, itself, etc.; first in Alc. 78, Hdt., and Att. ( Hom. has ἕο αὐτοῦ, οἷ αὐτῷ, ἑ αὐτόν): αὐτὸ ἐφʼ ἑαυτό ( v.l. - τοῦ) itself by itself, absolutely, Pl. Tht. 152b; αὐτὸ ἐφʼ αὑτοῦ ib. 160b; ὅταν τὸ ἐφʼ ἑαυτὸν ἕκαστος σπεύδῃ Th. 1.141; αὐτὸ καθʼ αὑτό Pl. Tht. 157a; αὐτὰ πρὸς αὑτά ib. 154e; ἀφʼ ἑαυτῶν, ἑαυτοῦ, of themselves, himself, Th. 5.60, X. Mem. 2.10.3; ἐφʼ ἑαυτοῦ, v. ἐπί; ἐν ἑαυτῷ γίγνεσθαι, ἐντὸς ἑαυτοῦ γ., v. ἐν, ἐντός; παρʼ ἑαυτῷ at his own house, ib. 3.13.3, etc.: esp. with Comp. and Sup., ἐγένοντο ἀμείνονες αὐτοὶ ἑωυτῶν they surpassed themselves, Hdt. 8.86; πλουσιώτεροι ἑαυτῶν continually richer, Th. 1.8; θαρραλεώτεροι αὐτοὶ ἑαυτῶν Pl. Prt. 350a, cf. d; τῇ αὐτὸ ἑωυτοῦ ἐστι μακρότατον at its very greatest length, Hdt. 2.8, cf. 149, 4.85, 198.

data.quote: ὅταν τὸ ἐφʼ ἑαυτὸν ἕκαστος σπεύδῃ

children.label: II
children.definition: Att., Trag., and later, αὑτοῦ, etc., is used for the 1st or 2nd pers., as for ἐμαυτοῦ, αὐτὸς καθʼ αὑτοῦ τἄρα μηχανορραφῶ A. Ch. 221, cf. S. OT 138, etc.; for σεαυτοῦ, μόρον τὸν αὑτῆς οἶσθα A. Ag. 1297, cf. 1141, Pl. Phd. 101c (v.l.), Ph. Bel. 59.16, etc.: so in pl., τὰ αὑτῶν ( = ἡμῶν αὐτῶν) ἐκποριζώμεθα Th. 1.82; δώσομεν ἑαυτούς Epicur. Sent.Vat. 47; ἐφʼ ἑαυτοῖς by ourselves, LXX 1 Ki. 14.9, cf. PPar. 47.26 (ii B. C.), 2 Ep.Cor. 7.1, etc.; ἑαυτῶν, = ὑμῶν αὐτῶν, PPar. 63.128 (ii B. C.).

data.quote: ἐμαυτοῦ, αὐτὸς καθʼ αὑτοῦ τἄρα μηχανορραφῶ

children.label: III
children.definition: ἑαυτῶν, ἑαυτοῖς, etc., is sts. used for ἀλλήλων, ἀλλήλοις, one another, διάφοροι ἑωυτοῖσι Hdt. 3.49; παρακελευόμενοι ἐν ἑαυτοῖς Th. 4.25, etc.; καθʼ αὑτοῖν one against the other, S. Ant. 144 (anap.); πρὸς αὑτούς D. 18.19; περιιόντες αὑτῶν πυνθάνονται Id. 4.10, cf. Pl. Ly. 215b.

definition: ἑάφθη, found only in Il. 13.543 ἐπὶ δʼ ἀσπὶς ἑάφθη καὶ κόρυς and 14.419 ἐπʼ αὐτῷ ἀσπὶς ἑάφθη. (Acc. to Tyrannio ap.Sch.A,

children.definition: was fastened, i.e. to him clung, his shield; acc. to Aristarch., connected with ἕπομαι, shield and helmet followed after: ἑ- Aristarch., ἐ- most Mss.; possibly connected with ἰάπτω (q. v.), was hurled over him; glossed by ἐκάμφθη, ἐβλάβη, Hsch.)

definition: ἐάω, contr. ἐῶ Il. 8.428, etc.; Ep. εἰῶ 4.55; Ep. 2 and 3 sg. ἐάᾳς, ἐάᾳ, Od. 12.137, Il. 8.414; inf. ἐάαν Od. 8.509: impf. εἴων,-ας, -α, Il. 18.448, Od. 19.25, Th. 1.28, etc.; Ion. and Ep. ἔων Hdt. 9.2, ἔα Il. 5.517, 16.731; also ἔασκον or εἴασκον, 2.832, 5.802, etc.: fut. ἐάσω [ᾱ] 18.296, etc.: aor. εἴᾱσα ( εἴᾰσεν is v.l. for εἴᾱςʼ in 10.299) 24.684, etc.; Ep. ἔᾱσα 11.437: pf. εἴᾱκα D. 8.37, 43.78, Cerc. 17.35:— Pass., fut. ἐάσομαι in pass. sense, E. IA 331, Th. 1.142: aor. εἰάθην Isoc. 4.97: pf. Pass. εἴᾱμαι D. 45.22.— Hdt. never uses the augm. in this Verb. [ ᾰ in pres. and impf., ᾱ in fut. and aor. even in Ion. (so prob. in Anacr. 56, 57; forms with - ασσ- occur as vv.ll. in Hom. and Parm. 8.7). Synizesis occurs in 3 sg. ἐᾷ Il. 5.256, in 1 subj. ἐῶμεν 10.344, and prob. in ἐάσουσιν Od. 21.233; also in Trag., in imper. ἔα S. OT 1451, Ant. 95, Ar. Nu. 932; ind. ἐῶ Id. Lys. 734: Hsch. has the form ἦσεν· εἴασεν, cf. ἦσαι· παῦσαι]:—

children.label: Α
children.definition: suffer, permit, c. acc. pers. et inf., τούσδε δʼ ἔα φθινύθειν leave them alone to perish, Il. 2.346; αἴ κεν ἐᾷ με . . ζώειν Od. 13.359, etc.; ἐᾶν οἰκεῖν Th. 3.48, cf. IG 1(2).1; ἐ. τοὺς Ἕλληνας αὐτονόμους ib. 2.17.9; ἐᾶν ἄκλαυτον, ἄταφον S. Ant. 29, cf. Tr. 1083; ἐᾶν τί τινι Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.233d:—so in Pass., Κρέοντί γε θρόνους ἐᾶσθαι should be given up, S. OC 368.

children.label: b
children.definition: concede, allow in argument, c. acc. et inf., Pl. Prm. 135b.

οὐκ ἐᾶν not to suffer: hence, forbid, prevent, τρεῖν μʼ οὐκ ἐᾷ Παλλὰς Ἀθήνη Il. 5.256; εἴπερ γὰρ φθονέω τε καὶ οὐκ εἰῶ διαπέρσαι 4.55; esp. of the law, Aeschin. 3.21; δμωὰς δʼ οὐκ εἴας προβλωσκέμεν Od. 19.25, etc.: used elliptically with ἀλλά following, οὐκ ἐῶν φεύγειν, ἀλλὰ [κελεύων] μένοντας ἐπικρατέειν Hdt. 7.104, cf. Th. 2.21; also, persuade or advise not to do . . , Id. 1.133: an inf. may freq. be supplied, οὐκ ἐάσει σε τοῦτο will not allow thee [to do] this, S. Ant. 538; κἂν μηδεὶς ἐᾷ even if all men forbid, Id. Aj. 1184, cf. Ph. 444:—so in Pass., οὐκ ἐᾶσθαι, c. inf., to be hindered, E. IT 1344, Th. 1.142, D. 2.16.

data.quote: τρεῖν μʼ οὐκ ἐᾷ Παλλὰς Ἀθήνη
εἴπερ γὰρ φθονέω τε καὶ οὐκ εἰῶ διαπέρσαι
οὐκ ἐῶν φεύγειν, ἀλλὰ [κελεύων] μένοντας ἐπικρατέειν

children.label: II
children.definition: let alone, let be, c. acc., ἔα χόλον Il. 9.260; μνηστήρων μὲν ἔα βουλήν heed not the suitors’ plan, Od. 2.281; ἐπεί με πρῶτον ἐάσας as soon as thou hast dismissed me, Il. 24.557, cf. 569, 684; ἤ κέν μιν ἐρύσσεαι, ἦ κεν ἐάσῃς or wilt leave him alone, 20.311, cf. Hdt. 6.108, etc.; ἐάσωμεν ἕκηλον αὐτόν S. Ph. 825; [ πρᾶγμα] ἀκάθαρτον ἐᾶν Id. OT 256; τὰ παθήματα . . παρεῖσʼ ἐάσω Id. OC 363, cf. Th. 2.36; ἐᾶν φιλοσοφίαν Pl. Grg. 484c: c. inf., ἐπὶ Σκύθας ἰέναι . . ἔασον let it alone, Hdt. 3.134; κλέψαι μὲν ἐάσομεν Ἕκτορα we will have done with stealing Hector, Il. 24.71; ἐᾶν περί τινος Pl. Prt. 347c, etc.; ἐῶ γὰρ εἰ φίλον D. 21.122: abs., ἀλλʼ ἄγε δὴ καὶ ἔασον have done, let be, Il. 21.221, cf. A. Pr. 334; οὐ χρὴ μάχεσθαι πρὸς τὸ θεῖον, ἀλλʼ ἐᾶν E. Fr. 491.5; θεὸς τὸ μὲν δώσει, τὸ δʼ ἐάσει he will give one thing, the other he will let alone, Od. 14.444:— Pass., ἡ δʼ οὖν ἐάσθω S. Tr. 329, etc.

data.quote: οὐ χρὴ μάχεσθαι πρὸς τὸ θεῖον, ἀλλʼ ἐᾶν

children.definition: ἐᾶν χαίρειν, v. χαίρω sub fin. ( ἐϝάω, cf. ἔβασον· ἔασον, and εὔα· ἔα, Hsch. who also has ἔησον· ἔασον.)

definition: ἐβαδίαστον μελανόβροχον, Hsch. ἐβάθη· ἐγεννήθη, Id.; cf. Lith. giṁti.
ἑβδεμήκοντα, Dor. for ἑβδομ-, GDI 2562.18 (Delph.), Tab.Heracl. 1.23:—also ἑβδέματος, ον,

children.definition: Philol. 71.6 ( Argos, iv B. C.).
born on the seventh day [of the month], epith. of Apollo, Plu. QConv. 2.717e.

definition: ἑβδομαγέτης, ου, ὁ, ( ἡγέομαι) epith. of Apollo, to whom the Spartans

children.definition: offered sacrifices on the seventh of every month, A. Th. 800, cf. Hdt. 6.57.
weekly, ἀριθμός Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.3.1; περίοδος Gal. 9.914, Theol.Ar. 45. Adv. -κῶς Steph. in Hp. 1.198 D.

children.label: II
children.definition: septenary, Procl. in Ti. 3.108 D., Dam. Pr. 264, 265. Adv. - κῶς ib. 263.
keep the Sabbath, LXX Ez. 21.23(28), Tz. H. 10.675.

on the seventh day, ἱδρώς Hp. Aph. 4.36; ἑ. πυρετός a fever recurring every seven days, Id. Epid. 1.24: ἑ. τραγῳδοί Luc. Hist.Conscr. 1: with a Verb, διεφθείροντο ἑβδομαῖοι Th. 2.49, cf. X. HG 5.3.19, Plu. Galb. 7; ἑ. ἡμέρα PSI 6.690 (i/ii A.D.).
seven days old, τράγος Horap. 1.48.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἑβδομ-αῖον, τό, monthly festival of Apollo, IG 2(2).1357 (iv B.C.), cf. ἑβδομαγέτης: pl., Schwyzer 687 B 4 ( Chios, vii/vi B.C.), 726.6 ( Milet., v B. C.).
seven times, Call. Del. 251.
the number seven, Ph. 1.21, Dam. Pr. 264, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: a number of seven, APl. 16.131 (Antip.(?)).
period of seven days, week, Hp. Aph. 2.24, LXX Ex. 34.22, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: period of seven years, Sol. 27.7, Arist. Pol. 1336b40, Placit. 4.11.4; ἐτῶν ἑ. J. AJ 3.12.3.

definition: ἑβδοματικός, ή, όν, = - αδικός, Ph. 2.206, J. AJ 11.8.6.

children.definition: seventh, Il. 7.248, al.
worshipped on the seventh day, epith. of Apollo, IG 2.1653.
receive a name at seven days of age, as was customary, Lys. Fr. 95 S.
of seventy weeks, χρόνος Tz. H. 8.54.
seventy-sixth, ἡμέρας -ον (sc. μέρος) Gem. 8.59.
seventy, Hdt. 1.32, X. An. 4.7.8, etc.
work in seventy books, Paul.Aeg. Praef.
170 times as great, Procl. Hyp. 4.104.
seventy times, LXX Ge. 4.24, Ev.Matt. 18.22.
seventy cubits high, Ph.Byz. Mir. 4.3.
possessing seventy ἄρουραι, PCair.Zen. 1.23 (iii B. C.), PTeb. 62.30 (ii B. C.).
group of seventy, Tz. H. 1.974.
seventy stades broad, πορθμός Str. 9.5.13.
seventy years old, Luc. Alex. 34: fem. - οῦτις Id. Rh.Pr. 24, D.C. 46.18.
seventy-second, μόριον Plu. Fac.lun. 2.932a.
seventy-first: τὸ ἑ. one seventy-first part, Archim. Circ. 3.
seventy-fifth, Tz. H. 12.908.
seventy-third, Tz. H. 13.439.
seventieth, Hp. Epid. 7.7, LXX Za. 1.12.
seventh, Il. 19.117, etc.; ἡ ἑβδόμη the seventh day, Hdt. 6.57 (pl.), Arist. HA 588a8; sabbath, Ph. 1.675, Ep.Hebr. 4.4.
A. Th. 125 (lyr., s.v.l.), cf. Thom.Mag. p.133 R.; ἐν κύκλοισιν ἑβδόμοις Milet. 6.46.
ἕβδομα, τά, seven years’ work, LXX Ge. 29.27.

definition: ἐβέβλις θήκη ἀργυρίου, καὶ κίστη, Hsch.

children.definition: of ebony, δίφρος CIG 3071 ( Teos), cf. Str. 15.1.54, Peripl.M.Rubr. 36, PMag.Berol. 1.279.

definition: ἔβενος, ἡ ( ὁ in BCH 35.286 ( Delos, ii B. C.)),

children.definition: ebony, Hdt. 3.97, Theoc. 15.123:—being the black heart-wood of various species of Diospyrus, ἐ. Αἰθιοπική, = D. mespiliformis, ἐ. Ἰνδική, = D. Ebenum, Dsc. 1.98, cf. Arist. Mete. 384b17, Thphr. HP 1.5.4 (but ἐβένη, ἡ, ib. 4.4.6). (Prob. an Egyptian word.)
Dsc. 4.134; = καλλίτριχον, ibid.
ἐβλόν· ἀπόπληκτον, Hsch.

Hebrew: and as Subst., a Hebrew, 2 Ep.Cor. 11.22, Paus. 1.5.5, App. BC 2.71; Ἑ. ἐξ Ἑβραίων Ep.Phil. 3.5, etc.; opp. Ἑλληνιστής, a Jew who used the Hebrew (Aramaic) language, Act.Ap. 6.1:— Adj. Ἑβραϊκός, ή, όν, Hebrew, γράμματα Ev.Luc. 23.38 (s.v.l.):—fem. Ἑβραΐς, ίδος, διάλεκτος Act.Ap. 21.40; γυναῖκες J. AJ 2.9.5:—Verb Ἑβραΐζω, speak Hebrew, Id. BJ 6.2.1:— Adv. Ἑβραϊστί, in the Hebrew tongue, LXX Si.prol., Ev.Jo. 19.20, etc.
he-goat, Hsch.

definition: ἐγ-, for ἐν in compos. before γ κ χ ξ; also for ἐκ in Inscrr. and Pap. before δ λ μ.

children.definition: Nic. Th. 37.
IG 4.853.26 ( Methana).

definition: ἔγγαιος, α, ον, more commonly ἔγγειος, ον, ( γαῖα, γῆ)

children.definition: in or of the land, native, ἥβα A. Pers. 922 (anap.); τις . . οἰωνοπόλων ἔγγαιος Id. Supp. 59 (lyr.).
within the land, opp. ὑπερόριος, X. Smp. 4.31.

children.label: II
children.definition: in land, consisting of land, οὐσία Lys. Fr. 91, D. 36.5; κτήσεις ἔγγειοι καὶ οἰκίαι IG 9(2).338.9 (Thess.), cf. CIG 2056 ( Odessus), Plb. 6.45.3; τὰ ἔγγεια the fixtures of a farm, D. 30.30; συμβόλαιον ἔγγειον Id. 33.3; στατῆρας δανεισάμενος ἐγγείων τόκων on mortgage, Id. 34.23 ( ἑκατὸν μνᾶς ἐγγείους (v.l. ἐγγύους) ἐπὶ τόκῳ δεδανεισμένας is read by codd. in Lys. 32.15); ἔγγεια καὶ ναυτικά PEleph. 1.13 (iv B.C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: in or of the earth, [ φυτὰ] ἔγγεια plants, Pl. R. 491d; φυτὸν οὐκ ἔγγειον, ἀλλὰ οὐράνιον Id. Ti. 90a; λίθων τὰ ἔγγαια μέρη Plu. QConv. 2.701c.

children.label: IV
children.definition: in or below the earth, = χθόνιος, Ἀϊδωνεύς AP 7.480 ( Leon.); χθόνιον καὶ ἔ. σκότος Plu. Frig. 2.953a; opp. ἐναέριος, Them. Or. 13.168b.
spend life calmly, Epicur. Ep. 1p.4U.
giving milk, in milk, of a ewe, Hsch.
marry into a family, Aesop. 21c, Hsch.
give in marriage, Eust. 758.54, Gloss.
nuptial, PSI 2.220 (iii A. D.).
PTeb. 5.182 (ii B.C.).
one that prophesies from the belly, Poll. 2.168, Suid. s.v. ἐγγαστρίμυθος.

definition: ἐγγαστριμάχαιρα [ μᾰ], ἡ, comic name of a glutton in Hippon. 85,

children.definition: one who makes havoc with his belly.

ventriloquist, mostly of women who delivered oracles by this means: hence, = ἐγγαστρίμαντις, Hp. Epid. 5.63, Philoch. 192, LXX Le. 19.31, Ph. 1.654, Plu. Def.orac. 2.414e, Luc. Lex. 20; also, the familiar spirit of such a person, LXX 1 Ki. 28.8.
in the womb, Man. 1.189.

definition: ἔγγαυρον νοτερόν, ὑγρόν; also ἄωρον, πρόσφατον, Hsch. ἔγγαυσον· ἔνσκαμβον, Id.; cf. γαυσός. ἐγγέαβλος· νεωκόρος, Id.
ἐγγέγαα, Ep. pf. of ἐγγίγνομαι. ἐγγεγωνώς· βοήσας, Hsch.
ἐγγείνωνται, 3 pl. aor. 1 subj. in causal sense (no pres. ἐγ-γείνομαι being found), μὴ μυῖαι εὐλὰς ἐγγείνωνται lest the flies

children.definition: breed maggots in [the wounds], Il. 19.26.
growing in the earth, of truffles, Thphr. HP 1.6.9, cf. Fr. 167.
having leaves close to the ground, Thphr. HP 6.6.7.
fracture of the skull, such that one piece slips under the bone like a cornice, Heliod. ap. Orib. 46.15.1, Sor. Fract. 5, Gal. 14.782.
mocker, scorner, E. Hipp. 1000.

laugh at, mock, τοῖς ποιουμένοις S. El. 277, cf. E. Med. 1355; in tmesi, γέλωτʼ ἐν σοὶ γελῶ S. Ant. 551 codd.; κατά τινος Id. OC 1339: without dat. expressed, Id. El. 807, E. Med. 1362; εἴς τινα Herod. 1.77:— Pass., Luc. Ind. 15.

children.label: II
children.definition: laugh in or among, αὔρα ἐγγελῶσα κύμασιν Sosicr. 2.
inborn, native, δαίμονες A.R. 4.1549.
native, Αἰγύπτιοι Hdt. 2.47; opp. μέτοικος, ἐ. Θηβαῖος S. OT 452; θεοὺς τοὺς ἐ. gods of the race or country, A. Th. 582, S. Ant. 199, cf. El. 428; νόμος J. AJ 15.7.10.
born of the same race, kindred, S. OT 1168, 1506, Inscr.Cos 124; ἐ. κηδεία connexion with a kinsman, E. Supp. 134. Adv. - νῶς like kinsmen, S. OT 1225.

children.label: II
children.definition: inborn, innate, νοῦς Id. El. 1328; σφίσιν ἐγγενὲς ἔμμεν ἀεθληταῖς ἀγαθοῖσιν ʼtis in their race to be good athletes, Pi. N. 10.51; πόνος ἐ. in the family, A. Ch. 466 (lyr.); τἀγγενῆ κακά S. OT 1430.

children.label: III
children.definition: = Lat. ingenuus, PGnom. 29.
hereditary, ἱερεύς OGI 583.5 ( Cyprus, i A.D.).
generate or produce in, τινί Plu. Sanit. 2.132e: abs., Them. Or. 13.166d.
place of generation, νεοττῶν Pl. Lg. 776a.

definition: ἔγγεον ἰοῦγον, Hsch.; cf. Lat. jugum ‘taxable unit of land, etc.’

children.definition: taste of, αἵματος Plb. 7.13.7.
residents in a country, Supp.Epigr. 1.325 ( Thrace).
employment for old age, Cic. Att. 12.25.2, Plu. Cat.Ma. 24.

definition: ἐγγηράσκω, Lib. Or. 61.9 ( ἐγγηρ-άω Anon. in EN 237.2), fut. - άσομαι [ᾱ] (v. infr.):—

children.definition: grow old with or in, μεγέθει σώματος Hp. Aph. 2.54; ταῖς βασιλείαις Plb. 6.7.4, cf. D.S. 11.23, Plu. Tim. 15.
grow old in one, decay, τὴν ἐπιστήμην ἐγγηράσεσθαι Th. 6.18; πρὶν ἐγγηρᾶσαι τὴν ἀκμὴν τῆς ἐλπίδος Plu. Nic. 14.

data.quote: πρὶν ἐγγηρᾶσαι τὴν ἀκμὴν τῆς ἐλπίδος

children.definition: Poll. 2.13 ( Pass.).

definition: ἐγγῆρυς ἡ γῆ, παρὰ Ἀττικοῖς, Hsch.

children.definition: to be near akin, LXX Ne. 13.4 (s.v.l.).

definition: ἐγγίγνομαι, Ion. and later ἐγγίνομαι [ῑ], fut. ἐγγενήσομαι: 3 pl. Ep. pf. ἐγγεγάᾱσι (the only tense used by Hom.):—

children.definition: to be born in, τοὶ Ἰλίῳ ἐγγεγάασιν Il. 6.493, cf. Od. 13.233; of vermin, to be bred in the skin, Hdt. 2.37; of stones, ἐν τῷ καρπῷ ἐ. ib. 92.

spring up, appear in or among, ὅσα ἐν ἀνθρώπου φύσι . . ἐ. Id. 8.83, cf. Pl. R. 351d; αἴσθημά τι κἀν νηπίοις γε . . ἐ. E. IA 1244: c. dat., ἃ παρθένοις ἐγγίγνεται νοσήμαθʼ Id. Ion 1524, cf. Th. 2.49, X. Mem. 1.2.21, etc.; of persons, Pl. Grg. 526a.

data.quote: αἴσθημά τι κἀν νηπίοις γε . . ἐ.

children.definition: take place or happen in or among, τισί Hdt. 5.3, cf. 3.1; χεῖμα σφοδρὸν ἐ. Pl. Ax. 371d.

children.label: II
children.definition: come in, intervene, λόγους ἐγγίνεσθαι Hdt. 2.121.δʹ; χρόνου ἐγγινομένου, ἐγγενομένου, Id. 1.190, Th. 1.113, etc.; ἵνα μοι χρόνος ἐγγένηται τῆ σκέψει Pl. Prt. 339e, cf. Smp. 184a.

data.quote: ἵνα μοι χρόνος ἐγγένηται τῆ σκέψει

children.label: III
children.definition: ἐγγίγνεται, impers., it is allowed or possible, c. inf., Hdt. 1.132, 6.38, And. 1.141, Pl. Phd. 66c; ὥστε μὴ ἐγγενέσθαι μοι ποιῆσαι Antipho 5.17; ἐγγενόμενον ἡμῖν when it was in our power, Is. 5.19.

children.label: IV
children.definition: aor. ἐγγείνασθαι, v. ἐγγείνωνται.
acknowledge, ἔρωτα Aret. SD 1.5.

definition: ἐγγίζω, aor. ἤγγισα Arist. (v. infr.): pf. ἤγγικα LXX Ez. 7.4(7), Ev.Matt. 3.2: ( ἐγγύς):—

children.label: Α
children.definition: bring near, bring up to, τῇ γῇ τὰς ναῦς Plb. 8.4.7; τὰ φιλήματα τοῖς χείλεσι Ach.Tat. 2.37; τινὰ πρός τινα LXX Ge. 48.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: approach, Arist. Mir. 845a20; τινί Plb. 18.4.1: c. gen., τῆς Αἰτωλίας Id. 4.62.5, etc.; πρὸς τὸν θεόν LXX Ex. 19.21; εἰς θάνατον ib. Jb. 33.22; ἕως ib. Si. 37.30(33); μέχρι θανάτου Ep.Phil. 2.30; to be imminent, ἤγγικεν ἡ παρουσία τοῦ Κυρίου Ep.Jac. 5.8: also, c. gen., approximate to, Phld. Herc. 1457.4.
to be next of kin, LXX Le. 21.3.

children.label: III
children.definition: inf., to be on the point of doing, ναοῦ -οντος συμπεσεῖν IG 12(1).1270.8 ( Syme).

definition: ἐγγίων, ον, ἔγγιστος, η, ον, Comp. and Sup. Adj., formed from Adv. ἐγγύς:—

children.definition: nearer, nearest, οὐδὲν ἡμῖν ἐστὶν ἔγγιον ἡμῶν αὐτῶν Procl. in Alc. p.6C.; ἔτη δέκα τὰ ἔγγιστα IG 7.2225.24 ( Thisbe): neut. ἔγγιον, ἔγγιστα, as Adv., Hp. Vict. 1.35 (also - υτότατα ibid.), 2.44, etc.; ἐξ ἐγγίονος App. BC 4.108; τοὺς ἔγγιστα τῆς Ἀττικῆς τόπους Decr. ap. D. 18.165; οἱ ἔγγιστα the next of kin, Antipho 4.4.1; ἔγγιστα approximately, of numbers, Autol. 1.6, Vett.Val. 153.21, etc.; αἱ ἔγγιστα τᾶς τοῦ ἀμβλυγώνου κώνου τομᾶς asymptotes of the hyperbola, Archim. Con.Sph.Praef.; of Time, next, forthcoming, ἡ ἔγγιστα ἀρίθμησις POxy. 1258.7 (i A.D.).

data.quote: οὐδὲν ἡμῖν ἐστὶν ἔγγιον ἡμῶν αὐτῶν

children.definition: blueish, D.S. 1.12.
Hsch.
sweetish, Dsc. 5.6.
ornamental carvings, IG 4.1485.91,96 (Epid.).
intaglio, Them. Or. 4.62b.
to have a sweet taste, Hdt. 2.92.
carving, engraving, Phld. Po. 1676.5.
carved, TAM 2.210 ( Sidyma), Prisc.p.311 D.

carve, ζῷα ἐν λίθοισι Hdt. 2.4; ζῷα ἐγγεγλυμμένα ib. 124; αἱμασιὴ ἐγγεγλυμμένη τύποισι ib. 138; λίθος εἰκόνα -γεγλυμμένος J. AJ 19.2.3; hollow out, [ γογγύλην] Dsc. 2.110, al.:— Pass., ὀστοῦ-γλυφέντος having a groove, Gal. 2.255.
Ar. Av. 1695, cf. EM 309.51, etc.
Suid., cf. Sch. Ar. Th. 138.
talk loudly of, Ar. Eq. 782.
bend in, ἐν δὲ γόνυ γνάμψεν, i.e. caught the back of the knee with his foot so as to trip him up and throw him, Il. 23.731.
bring on by charms, ὕπνον ἐ. τινί Philostr. VA 3.8.
laden, κάμηλοι OGI 629.166 ( Palmyra, ii A.D.), Gloss.
nail, fix in, Gal. 2.336:— Pass., of the teeth, ib. 754 (ap. Orib. 25.6.4).
fixing in of teeth, Gal. 12.851.
ὁ, indecl., kneeling figure, name of the constellation Hercules, Arat. 66, 669, Gal. 9.936, etc.

definition: ἐγγονεῖν, written for ἐγκονεῖν in Hsch.

children.definition: grandson, D.H. 6.37, etc.: ἐγγόνη, ἡ, grand-daughter, IGRom. 4.882 ( Themisonium), Artem. 4.69, Lyd. Mag. 2.1; also ἔγγονος, ἡ, Plu. Per. 3.

descendant, Pl. R. 364e, D. 19.48,54, etc.; ἔκγ- is v.l. in ll.cc., and may be right in Arist. Pol. 1335a13, cf. ib. b30; τὰ ἔγγονα issue, Inscr.Cos 36a4, PFreib. 10.8, etc.; of animals, Ph. 2.396, al.; Ἔρως πυρὸς ἔγγονε APl. 16.212 ( Alph.).

productive, κακίας, μνήμης, Callistr. Stat. 10. [ ἔγγ- may represent ἔκγ- (q.v.), both forms are found in Att. Inscrr. up to ca. 300 B.C.; ἔγγ- is rare in Hellenistic Greek, OGI 49.12 (iii B. C.), PTeb. 124.25, 33 (ii B. C.); but more freq. later; ἐνγ- is written in SIG 333.25 ( Samos, iv B. C.), dub. in CIG 3185 ( Smyrna).]

definition: ἐγγοργῶν φοβερῶς βλέψας, Hsch.:—also aor. Med. ἐ<γ>γοργώψατο, Id.; cf. γοργώψατο.

children.definition: written, λόγος φωνὴ ἐ. Pl. Def. 414d, cf. Ph. 1.321, Arr. Epict. 1.20.4, S.E. M. 1.100.

children.label: II
children.definition: containing letters, descriptive of letters, ῥῆσις Ath. 10.454b.

children.label: III
children.definition: literate, POxy. 1467.13 (iii A. D.).
Plb. 12.9.3, al.; νόμοι Str. 6.1.8, D.S. 1.94; πρᾶγμα ἔ. καὶ ἄγραφον PAmh. 2.110 (i A.D.), etc.: ἔγγραπτον, τό, written document, PMagd. 18.5 (iii B.C.).
anchovy, ἐγγραύλεις, οἱ δὲ ἐγκρασιχόλους καλοῦσιν αὐτάς, Ael. NA 8.18, Opp. H. 4.470.

data.quote: ἐγγραύλεις, οἱ δὲ ἐγκρασιχόλους καλοῦσιν αὐτάς,

children.definition: registrar, Gloss.

registration, πολιτῶν Arist. Ath. 43.1, cf. Ph. 2.51; of persons on the list of their deme, D. 39.5 (pl.), IG 2(2).1028.6 (pl.); of ἄτιμοι, D. 25.28; of public debtors, Id. 37.6; of those subject to penalties, Arist. Pol. 1322a1 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: engraving of an inscription, Ἀρχ.Ἐφ. 1911.141 ( Gonni).
inscribing of a figure, Papp. 150.8, al.; cf. ἐκγραφή.

definition: ἐγγραφής, ές, = ἔγγραφος, Anon. in EN 245.30.
ἔγγραφος, ον, Dor. ἔγγροφος SIG 712.35 ( Crete),

children.definition: written, Plb. 3.21.4, Luc. Herm. 24, etc.; ἔγγραφα, τά, documents, OGI 335.137 (Pergam.). Adv. - φως Inscr.Prien. 113.37 (i B. C.), J. BJ 1.27.1, SIG 880.68 ( Pizus), Porph. Chr. 27.

children.label: II
children.definition: enrolled, IG 1(2).949.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἔγγραφοι πατέρες, = patres conscripti, D.H. 2.12.
make incisions into, τὸ στέλεχος Thphr. HP 5.1.2.
mark in or on, paint on, ζῷα ἐς τὴν ἐσθῆτα ἐ. Hdt. 1.203; opp. ἐξαλείφω, Pl. R. 501b.

engrave, inscribe, ἐν τῇσι στήλῃσι Hdt. 2.102, cf. 4.91; νόμους Lys. 30.2 (of codifiers, opp. ἐξαλείφω): — Med., ἢν ἐγγράφου σὺ μνήμοσιν δέλτοις φρενῶν A. Pr. 789:— Pass., to be written in, ἐνεγέγραπτο δὲ τάδε ἐν αὐτῇ (sc. τῇ ἐπιστολῇ) Th. 1.128; αὑτὸν εὗρεν ἐγγεγραμμένον κτείνειν found his name entered in the letter for execution, ib. 132; δέλτον ἐγγεγραμμένην συνθήμαθʼ S. Tr. 157.

data.quote: ἢν ἐγγράφου σὺ μνήμοσιν δέλτοις φρενῶν

children.definition: εἰ μέλλουσι τοιαῦται διάνοιαι ἐγγραφήσεσθαι ἀνθρώποις X. Cyr. 3.3.52.

data.quote: εἰ μέλλουσι τοιαῦται διάνοιαι ἐγγραφήσεσθαι ἀνθρώποις

children.definition: inscribe a figure in another, εἰς . . Euc. 4.4, al.; ἐν . . Archim. Sph. Cyl. 1.13, al. ( Pass.).
include in a prescription, οἶνος ἐγγεγράφθω Aret. CD 1.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: enter in the public register, esp. of oneʼs deme or phratria, ἐς τὰ κοινὰ γραμματεῖα Is. 7.1; ἐγγράψαι τὸν υἱὸν εἰς ἄνδρας D. 19.230; εἰς τοὺς φράτερας Id. 39.4; ἐ. εἰς τοὺς ἀτίμους Plu. Them. 6; also ἱερὰν ἐ. τὴν οὐσίαν Alex. 276:— Pass., εἰς τοὺς δημότας ἐγγραφῆναι D. 18.261; Μαντίθεος ἐνεγεγράμμην by the name of M., Id. 39.4; τοὺς μήπω διʼ ἡλικίαν ἐγγεγραμμένους Arist. Pol. 1275a15; πρὶν ἐγγραφῆναι καὶ λαβεῖν τὸ χλαμύδιον Antid. 2; εἰς τοὺς ἐφήβους Pl. Ax. 366e. ( A. Ch. 699 is corrupt.)

data.quote: πρὶν ἐγγραφῆναι καὶ λαβεῖν τὸ χλαμύδιον

children.definition: indict, Ar. Pax 1180, D. 37.24:— Pass., ἐγγράφεσθαι λιποταξίου to be indicted for desertion, Aeschin. 2.148.

enter their names, ἐγγραφόντων οἱ ἄρχοντες τοῖς πράκτορσιν Lex ap. D. 43.71; ἐγγεγραμμένος [ἐν ἀκροπόλει] registered among the state-debtors, D. 25.4, cf. Arist. Ath. 48.1; also of ἄτιμοι, Pl. Lg. 784d. (Perh. written ἐκγρ-, SIG 742.29.)

definition: ἐγγριμᾶσθαι ἐναγίσαι, Hsch. ἐγγρισμός· παροξυσμός, Id.; cf. ἀγγρίζειν. ἐγγυάζων· ἀντιφωνῶν, Id.
ἐγγυαλίζω, Ep. and Lyr. Verb, ( γύαλον) prop.

children.definition: put into the palm of the hand, put into the hand, ἔεδνα ὅσσα οἱ ἐγγυάλιξα Od. 8.319; ἐγὼ δέ τοι ἐγγυαλίξω I will put him into your hands, 16.66; ὁ δʼ αὖτʼ ἐμοὶ ἐγγυάλιξεν (sc. τοὺς ἵππους) Il. 23.278; freq. of the gods, καί τοι Ζεὺς ἐγγυάλιξε σκῆπτρόν τʼ ἠδὲ θέμιστας 9.98; τιμήν . . ὄφελλεν Ὀλύμπιος ἐγγυαλίξαι 1.353; τότε οἱ κράτος ἐγγυαλίξω 11.192; ὁτέοισιν κῦδος . . ἐγγυαλίξῃ 15.491, cf. A.R. 2.55, etc.; ἐ. ὄλβον Pi. Pae. 6.133, cf. I. 8(7).46, Hegem. ap. Ath. 15.698d.

data.quote: καί τοι Ζεὺς ἐγγυάλιξε σκῆπτρόν τʼ ἠδὲ θέμιστας

children.definition: Orion 51.2.
